From our previous conversations, I understand his deep appreciation for maritime trade efficiency despite being technically outside Venice's system.)(As a Forestieri merchant captain myself operating under Venetian rules, I need to approach this carefully but strategically. Directly asking to buy goods from him might seem too aggressive, given my limited political connections and the potential for appearing overly ambitious. A more measured tactic would be to demonstrate value through service while maintaining plausible deniability about our relationship.)(According to the activity details, Antonio just completed a delivery trip using one of my galleys — likely thanks to some favor or discount from me earlier. This presents an opportunity: by offering further logistical support at a nominal fee, I can strengthen his position without appearing desperate for business himself in Venice.)</think>"Ah, *signore*, you took the galley through those Adriatic waters with remarkable speed this time. It must be that Greek winter trade is very profitable indeed — or perhaps my rates were exceptionally favorable? Either way, such efficiency benefits all merchants here."
